inlineContent.text: An array specifically designed to hold bytes. Packs data tightly, so it saves memory for large array sizes.
also provides methods to encode/decode various types to/from bytes. The way values are encoded is an implementation detail and shouldn’t be relied upon when interacting with external apps.
Packed arrays are always passed by reference. To get a copy of an array that can be modified independently of the original array, use
the case for built-in properties and methods. The returned packed array of these are a copies, and changing it will
affect the original value. To update a built-in property you need to modify the returned array, and then assign it to the property again.

Sets the size of the array. If the array is grown, reserves elements at the end of the array. If the array is shrunk, truncates the array to the new size. Calling
once and assigning the new values is faster than adding new elements one by one.
Encodes a 64-bit signed integer number as bytes at the index of
bytes. The array must have at least 8 bytes of space, starting at the offset.

constructors that are declared on the various types that are wrapped.
